item.title: Small beginnings
item.description: Savor the winter bite, Though it stiffens your fingers to uselessness, Though as shards of glass, it moves to Pierce and flay you bare to bone Just to remind you again That you are not welcome here Savor it regardless; for it will Recommend you in the end, and testify on your behalf: He was cold so they could be warm Savor the exile, As their aspersions echo in triplicate,
